intro: Eriogonum acaule, commonly known as the leafless buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its lack of leaves, with the stems bearing clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open areas such as meadows and sagebrush steppe. Its flowers are typically visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological role. Eriogonum acaule is a member of the Polygonaceae family, known for its distinctive seed structures and ecological importance in arid environments.
